website_summaries.verdict: A quality almond butter with delicious flavor from a trusted brand.
pros: Justin's almond butter does not need to be refrigerated, leaving it smooth and easy to spread
Available in original, maple, cinnamon, vanilla, or honey flavors
The butter is filling and a quick spoonful can help keep you satisfied between meals
Available in jars, or in convenient travel-sized packets for on-the-go snacking
cons: Can contain traces of peanuts, tree nuts, and soy

customer_reviews.title: Unhealthy!!! Palm Oil YUCK!!! Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of ordering this without reading the two ingredients. One of them is palm oil~the worst most saturated oil of third world countries and processed foods. Palm oil should be illegal. It is VERY unhealthy. I give this to my dog as a treat sometimes in a cone, but will NEVER order again. I just subscribed to Almondee~only one ingredient and MUCH tastier~and of course healthier! I love my dog, but I think the oil won't hurt her (a little at a time) the same way that it hurts the epithelial cells lining human arteries. Buy Almondee instead folks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mistress Pleasure

customer_reviews.title: Calorie discrepancy on label
customer_reviews.text: I've been getting the justin's cashew butter and it's delicious. I saw online the almond butter came in a larger jar and had lower calories so I decided to give it a try. It seemed to have a good amount of excess liquid at the top for a no stir nut butter and I don't like the taste as much as the cashew variety. The biggest issue is that on both Amazon and the Justin's website it shows that the almond butter is 190 calories per serving but the jar I received shows its 220 calories per serving. Not sure how this could be different from listed but definitely would like some explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Maranda

customer_reviews.title: Good except for palm oil
customer_reviews.text: Minus one star for palm oil. None is really sustainable and it's not that good for you. Take it out and 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mattjki

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure You Stir It
customer_reviews.text: Good almond butter is a real treat. I use this for cooking and also use it as a spread. I talked myself into buying this brand and I've been loving it ever since. Remember to stir it after you open it, so the oil and the butter get mixed well. Otherwise, you'll end up with really dry almond butter at the bottom (see the photo with the spoon).
customer_reviews.author: Trading Robot

customer_reviews.title: Such a great alternative to peanut butter!! Made in a peanut-free facility!!
customer_reviews.text: When my son wanted to take "ants on a log" for his class treat, I had to find a peanut-free substitution because one of his classmates is allergic to peanuts. That was pretty easy - Almond butter. The problem is that all the options in my local grocery stores are made on machines that also process peanuts! Justin's saved the day, by having almond butter that is processed in a facility that is peanut free! I already had tried, and this tastes just as great! Also, I didn't have any issues with oil separation. Just a bit of oil on top the first time I opened it, but no more separating after that.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: My 9-year old daughter wanted to try almond butter. After reading the reviews for several different products, I picked this one and glad I did. As soon as it arrived we made almond butter and grape jelly sandwiches, and they were delicious! We’re now a fan and will be purchasing this again!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting almond butter
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the best tasting brand of almond butter I’ve tried and I have tried a lot! I had almost given up on almond butter and thought it was nasty until trying this one. We don’t have a Whole Foods or Trader Joe’s in my town (yeah I know it really sucks) so I was glad that Amazon had it!
customer_reviews.author: Javon

customer_reviews.title: Guilt free treat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the healthiest of options I can go without compromising the taste of "peanut butter". Great quick snack that isn't loaded with sugar and carbs. As you can see, there was no issue with consistency, didn't even need to stir it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Only almonds...and delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Every jar (with the exception on 1) has arrived thoroughly mixed with very minimal oil sitting on top (if any) which makes it easy to stir. The jar stays "stirred" until I finish it unlike other brands that you have to stir every time which can be messy and annoying. No other nuts added like many other almond butters I've tried which makes it ideal for me as we can't have cashews and other nuts in our household. It's simple and delicious...highly recommend. If you're a coconut lover, the Almond Coconut is absolutely delicious...just a touch more sugar though.
customer_reviews.author: AMoons

customer_reviews.title: Does taste trump spreadability?
customer_reviews.text: Well, after seeing all the great reviews on this almond butter, I decided to try it. I was so pleased to find that there wasn't a layer of oil setting on top of the contents. Hmm, turns out that is because there is none in it. It is very dry and almost impossible to spread. I wanted it to spread down the center of my celery stalks, but basically I just have to put little dabs along the stalk, since it doesn't really spread. Having said that, the TASTE is great. Yes, there is some graininess, but not much. Just good flavor. Now to figure out a way to make it usable for my celery snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Siawilin

customer_reviews.title: Palm oil, yuck!
customer_reviews.text: Should have looked more closely before buying two jars — this has palm oil to prevent separation. A little easier to get going, but a lot worse for you. Protip: the five minutes you spend with a palm-oil-free jar before tossing it in the fridge is probs worth it for heart health. Flavor is great, though. And if you want an almond butter that doesn’t separate, and don’t care about your long-term health or that of your kiddos, this is probably a solid pick.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peters

customer_reviews.title: What's up with the palm oil?
customer_reviews.text: I always thought this brand was the better for you brand at $10 a pop, it should be. But what did I find when I wondered why there was no oily mess on the top when I opened the jar? The ingredient label identifies palm oil as the second ingredient. Those words are a no no to my wife, so though I will eat it this once since we can't get the kind you grind yourself anymore, I will not likely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Not really "No Stir"
customer_reviews.text: I put this in the refrigerator without stirring and it was separated into mostly oil and then mostly solid. Not as bad as with some Almond butters. It also needs salt. So I'm going to stir it and put it back in the fridge. The label suggests keeping it at room temperature. Not sure I like the palm oil taste either. Pure almond butter is better but I'd sure like some that does not separate!
customer_reviews.author: Violets

customer_reviews.title: Did not like this brand. It has sort of a bitter taste.
customer_reviews.text: I love almonds and was hoping to like this almond butter. Unfortunately, I am not happy with it for a couple of reasons. First, it has a bitterness to the taste...or something. Just not what I was expecting and I don't like it. Second, I did not notice before purchasing it that it contains palm oil. I was looking for a nut butter that does not contain anything but ground nuts. Since I've opened the package and eaten some, I can't return it. Won't be buying this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: tastes absolutely amazing !
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a bit pricey for being an almond butter, but it tastes absolutely amazing. The positive of this almond butter is that it doesn’t have added sugar, which I am trying to avoid. I would totally recommend this to someone with a peanut allergy or just loves different nut butters! Justin's Almond Butter is naturally gluten-free, vegan and totally fit into whatever diet your on.
customer_reviews.author: Jor El

customer_reviews.title: Say No To Palm Oil
customer_reviews.text: This almond butter contains palm oil which is said to have been responsible for about 8% of the world's deforestation between 1990 and 2008. This is because forests are burned to clear areas where people can grow oil palms, even if it's illegal. Palm oil is also very unhealthy as it is high in saturated fat. I think I'll make my own almond butter with the only ingredient that should be in it - almonds.
customer_reviews.author: N. Calille

customer_reviews.title: One jar will last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: This reminds me of when I was a kid and used to sit on the beach forming damp sand into food and pretending to eat it. Except this is damp sand you can actually eat... After buying this I'm not really sure what I'm supposed to use it for. The flavor profile is bland and doesn't pair well with anything. It doesn't mix or spread well. Getting it out of the jar is more effort than it's worth. Might make a decent sandcastle out of it though..
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mac

customer_reviews.title: Recommend - great flavor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a particular recipe and enjoyed the taste so much that we are using it on toast and in other recipes. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ShenValley

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter suggested that I add this to my steel cut oats with my morning protein smoothies. I find it very tasty and lighter than peanut butter. It doesn't have that fatty taste that peanut butter has either. It's become a staple for my breakfast alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Dee S.

customer_reviews.title: Contains Palm Oil
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almond butter to make "fat bombs" (nut butter, coconut oil, spices, mix together, pour into small ice cube trays or candy molds. Let harden in the freezer.) What surprised me was it contains palm oil, which is something I try to avoid. So I will use this nut butter, but will not repurchase unless it does not contain the palm oil.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!  Contains Palm Oil!
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed to find out this product contains palm oil. So unhealthy and tastes terrible. It's going in the garbage. Always check the ingredients - Almond butter should only contain ALMONDS!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Justin's Classic Almond Butter
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this almond butter. Not as easy to spread as say peanut butter is, but it tastes sooo much better! And this doesn't make my tummy hurt. I love just eating it off of a spoon anyway! My favorite when I can afford it! Why is all the wonderful HEALTHY stuff ALWAYS more expensive? Poor folks like to eat healthy too!
customer_reviews.author: Southern gal

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Almond Butter!
customer_reviews.text: Jason makes my all-time favorite almond butter. It's delicious and nutritious! I love eating on celery for a healthy snack. I can even get my kids to eat celery this way!! :) It also tastes delicious when blended with frozen bananas. It feels like I'm cheating on my healthy diet!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Gullekson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many different kinds of almond butter and this by far is the easiest and most tolerable to eat. the spreadability is good etc. the only thing is when you get close to the bottom it’s hard to get out of the jar without making a huge mess but the besides that it’s good
customer_reviews.author: kittymagik

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed by palm oil
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say I’m disappointed- I didn’t realize there was palm oil in the ingredients. It tastes fine, but I’m going to go back to the Whole Foods almond butter with oil on top. For all the hype, it wasn’t anything mind blowing.
customer_reviews.author: roann

customer_reviews.title: Good until I learned palm oil is a bad thing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize palm oil was something you don't want in a nut butter (or in anything healthy, really). I was disappointed to see it listed as an ingredient. If you're not picky about that stuff, this almond butter was pretty good. Good spread-ability, but you do need to stir it because the top is always just a thick layer of oil. Sadly, I don't want my heart to have to deal with palm oil when I'm trying to eat healthy.
customer_reviews.author: NumiOmi

customer_reviews.title: Come on Justin.. what happened to quality?
customer_reviews.text: Calling this almond butter would be a stretch. It’s more like almond play dough. There is no oil or viscosity to this whatsoever. It tastes dry and is pretty much inedible. I used to enjoy this brand but now I’ll try other brands that do not use palm oil as a filler.
customer_reviews.author: JKCA

customer_reviews.title: Only one problem:
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is perfect, texture only a tiny bit dry. Problem: It came with a large air hole in the middle, so I definitely did not get the full amount for which I paid. Oh well; stuff happens. Otherwise, it would be ***** all the way through.
customer_reviews.author: napewastewin

customer_reviews.title: Read labels
customer_reviews.text: I'm not comfortable reading this on the label of a vegan products ( shared equipment )?! Husband said " stick to Jiff "!
customer_reviews.author: Charlette A. P. Kealoha

customer_reviews.title: not sweet, but good
customer_reviews.text: the taste is fine, but could stand to be a little sweeter. It’s literally just tastes like creamy nuts. make sure to stir it because the oil does settle on top, but that’s normal. I’d recommend it to my vegan grandmother.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: I used to pay more for freshly ground almond butter from a local Co-op, but this one might just work well instead. The taste is good, spreads better when you leave it out of the fridge for a bit, but it sure is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Dunja

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome. My only regret is the fact that I no longer eat this flavor, but not because of any shortcomings. As soon as I discovered Justin's "Maple Almond Butter" I can't order anything else. I am ordering them by the 3 pack now. This stuff is addictive. This almond butter will not disappoint, but for a slightly sweeter treat, based on the same almond butter, try a jar of the maple flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Just_Another_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dry!!
customer_reviews.text: Taste great however it is very dry and near impossible to spread. I have been eating almond butter for nearly 20 years and never have I had a brand that was drier than Play-Doh! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Pretty stiff
customer_reviews.text: Well I do like the flavor, and smell. It took some time to get the product stirred so that the oil and almond mixed up well enough to spread tho remains a stiff spread product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee6978

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong product!
customer_reviews.text: The image and description for this product says that it is the Classic Almond Butter, but I received the Maple flavor. It's dissapointing because I don't like the flavor and was primarily planning on using it in smoothies (definitely don't want a maple flavor in that). Unfortunately, I was so excited to get it that I opened it before I realized it was the wrong product, so I doubt its returnable. I don't know if this was a one time error, but I'm not going to try to buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Mary Tutt

customer_reviews.title: Too dry
customer_reviews.text: I had another organic almond butter that was smooth and creamy with the right amount of natural fat from the almonds making it creamy. I'm sorry to say, I didn't find this with your product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: This is awful
customer_reviews.text: This was hard barely moist paste, impossible to spread on bread. The taste is oily, I had no idea this was made with Palm Oil or I would never have purchased it. The packaging is 'cute' but not looking for cute in my food.
customer_reviews.author: Sftonyt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product it’s cheaper than it is in stores by 1.70 which is worth it to me 2wice a months for twelve months that’s over 20 bucks not a lot in the long run but it adds up when saving
customer_reviews.author: Nick C.

customer_reviews.title: Thick and sticky
customer_reviews.text: I put almond butter into smoothies. This is the first time I bought this brand. Very unusual as it did not need to be stirred the first time because it was very thick and sticky. Tasted okay.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: This isn't spreadable
customer_reviews.text: According to the product description, it's spreadable. I store it upside down and still it's separating and very hard to stir. Not happy with this almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: PattiC

customer_reviews.title: Unable to spread due to consistency
customer_reviews.text: The jar I received was solid. I couldn't even get a spoon to go into this. It appeared to have no oil at all. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy  MTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Getting accustom to change
customer_reviews.text: It tastes good but takes getting accustomed to it being different. All the years of eating peanut butter at first makes it strange plain. If you add jelly or jam to it helps. I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Added non almond oil effects taste.
customer_reviews.text: Too much added Non almond oil. Added oil not necessary and effects taste. Don’t like it. I have had better without added non almond oil. Pricy for an oily taste. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Keifer

customer_reviews.title: Not so much!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this was gonna be great. Extremely dry and literally no taste! I could get past the exceptual dry was if it had good taste but nothin'. Was really hopeful
customer_reviews.author: Cappuccino lover

customer_reviews.title: Delicious. Hearty. Healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this on my bananas. It’s not the easiest to spread, and it sticks to your mouth like crazy, but it’s a great tasting nut butter that makes me feel good eating it. Plus it’s like eighteen dollars at most stores here so Amazon THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: RebekahZ808

customer_reviews.title: The second ingredient is palm oil
customer_reviews.text: Why should you need to add oil to nut butters, which are already oily? It makes it fattier than other almond butters and is a way to stretch the almonds. Not for me!
customer_reviews.author: Native New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Yum Yum
customer_reviews.text: Taste Great! I’ve tried other almond butter and they don’t taste as good as this one. It is expensive but worth buying every once in a while. Taste yummy on celery sticks! Great snack!!
customer_reviews.author: likeable

customer_reviews.title: COOKIES!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flavor the most...sometimes I just eat it straight out of the jar! Wouldn't mind making Almond butter cookies with this! 😁
customer_reviews.author: I AM JUST ME

customer_reviews.title: Stale
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY! This product is OLD. Expiration date is in Nov. Of this year which means it has been sitting around somewhere for years. Dehydrated and dry, impossible to "stir" with a knife, can only be scooped out with a spoon All the wholesome oily qualities of the nut spread are gone. Big disappoinment. Makes me wary of buying any shelf stable food products from Amazon. When I buy this product from Target at least I know it's fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E.

customer_reviews.title: So tasty and creamy!
customer_reviews.text: One thing is dislike about almond butter is the thick palm oil layer on top. This does not have that! Easy to spread and so tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: It smoothly goes on the bread. Great taste. I usually make my own with whole Almonds but is allot of work so thought I'd try this. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't taste good to me, not as creamy as I like. It was cheaper so I thought I would try it. Nope back to Barney Butter's
customer_reviews.author: Tiburon

customer_reviews.title: Was not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I received in a timely manner but the product was very DRY. Hard to spread because of it being so dry. I’ve used this branD before, I’ve purchased in the store and It was never this dry. I’m not sure as to why it was so dry. That’s my only issue. I’d going to the purchase in store next time.
customer_reviews.author: Karl-Mark Songui

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: sooo good I love it. I actually eat it with chocolate or caramel rice cakes as a sandwich if I dont have lunch for work or for a quick on the go snack and have no time. the price is good I rather buy it from here than in a store they always run out of it .
customer_reviews.author: Iris Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: This is expensive, but worth. Gluten free, delicious, wonderful. Will order again, fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Joy R Wimer DeLima

customer_reviews.title: Delivered
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried this, yet. A friend highly recommended it. Lots of protein and great taste without being too sweet. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this stuff, but the last two jars have been like soup, and seemed to have less flavor. Too expensive for this kind of inconvenience and inconsistentcy.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: BEST
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other brands but I always go back to Justines. Best quality and taste.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Hills

customer_reviews.title: Peanut who?
customer_reviews.text: I will never eat peanut butter again. And I LOVE peanut butter. But, now on the Paleo diet which forbids PB. But will allow for this yummy stuff. It's really so good on everything that I used to put PB on. Celery, carrots and in shakes. And once I get me some Paleo bread I will be toasting it and laying some of this stuff on it. I can't wait!!! Seriously, this stuff is so delicious. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LMoore

customer_reviews.title: Requires Stirring Before Each Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it said “No Stir” but it separates and does require stirring.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Have it on subscription
customer_reviews.text: This almond butter tastes great. I bought one of those sample sized bag and really liked it and I ended up finding it on amazon for a much cheaper price. Now I have it on subscription so I never run out!
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: TRY IT. WOW.
customer_reviews.text: Fresh taste* Never tried almond butter before not if you haven't your missing out! Love this so much.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Law

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t it
customer_reviews.text: First time buying this kind. Not sure what the hype of this brand is but it’s not all that good. I’ve had better for around the same price and less. When I opened this it was very hard and the taste isn’t that great compared to others. It’s just super thick.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Aflalo

customer_reviews.title: tasty and healthy
customer_reviews.text: Good for you, tastes good, and even can be mixed with oil towards the end of stir-fry cooking to add a little body and flavor....throw in some hot-pepper flakes, garlic, etc. and you may eat out less.
customer_reviews.author: weekend rider

customer_reviews.title: SUPER GREAT FLAVOR. JUSTINS PROCESS IS PERFECT. AWESOME FLAVOR!!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT POWERFUL FLAVOR AND WELL BLENDED/MIXED. PERFECTED PROCESS. WELL DONE JUSTIN!!!
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Not creamy enough and not easy to spread
customer_reviews.text: Tastes good but is not creamy and hard to spread compared to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Tasteless
customer_reviews.text: The most tasteless item I have ever tried. Not a big fan of it. I will never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Something You May Have Missed
customer_reviews.text: This is the plain, plainer, painest form of nut butter, unfooled-around-with. Put it on your list of no-sugar-added treats, use it in place of commercial peanut butter, eat it out of the jar -- and add a bit of Morton's Salt Substitute if you really miss the salt in some other nut butters. It's on my short list of guilty pleasures, yet it is easy / easier to stop at a teaspoon of this almond butter out of the jar (unless there is nothing else for snacking).
customer_reviews.author: Siri Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Unspreadable
customer_reviews.text: Seem a lot more thicker and it was hard to spread this time.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Almond butter
customer_reviews.text: I love Justin's Almond butter. I get 2 shipped to me each month. 1 is always great, the other one is always dry like its the bottom of the batch. Expiration isnt until July 2020 but its very dry. The other jar is perfect. Disappointing since the price is great compared to in the stores around me.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H.

customer_reviews.title: It got solid / hard just an inch below the top -- had to work w spoon, to mix it
customer_reviews.text: It got solid / hard just an inch below the top -- had to work w spoon, to mix it. I will look for other brands next time
customer_reviews.author: n

customer_reviews.title: Tastes amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff! My favorite brand by far. Taste amazing
customer_reviews.author: Tara Stock

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor but too dry.
customer_reviews.text: The flavor was good but the butter was too dry that made it hard to use as a spread, ended up only using it in smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca

customer_reviews.title: Favorite almond butter
customer_reviews.text: This is my goto almond butter. Love the flavor and it’s easy to spread. The only thing I don’t like is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Coca

customer_reviews.title: Try the vanilla.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, Justin. Though pricey, you make the best nut butter I’ve ever had the pleasure to sample.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Task
customer_reviews.text: I was buying for a diet but it was horrible. I couldn't eat it.
customer_reviews.author: JSW

customer_reviews.title: Great taste.
customer_reviews.text: Great taste and it's good for you. I eat it on celery and it is as good as peanut butter.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Hochman

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Good, but Dry
customer_reviews.text: Although the flavors are great, the dry texture makes it hard to spread, and therefore less enjoyable. It needs to be creamier and smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Edmundo T. Mendiola

customer_reviews.title: Not my Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Justin's other butters are great. But this one, not so much. For me it just comes down to flavor and price. I like plain almond butter but for the price this one doesn't cut it. Try Justin's other flavors. Choco peanut butter is great. Maple Almond is legendary. There Choco hazelnut is pretty solid too, just a little more expensive that Nutella. The best thing about Justin's is the consistency of the butter. The texture is great. But I just don't like it on this plain almond butter.
customer_reviews.author: GC Frank

customer_reviews.title: Zero Taste
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the jar there was brown liquid. After pouring out liquid I mixed almond butter. ZERO taste! It was like eating cardboard paste. I would give a zero Star if possible. I will have to put straight in the garbage. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Plevel

customer_reviews.title: sooo good!
customer_reviews.text: i cannot get enough of this stuff, almond butter sandwiches w a protein shake r about to be my new thing after a workout ;__; definitely superior to peanut butter
customer_reviews.author: bri

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Very hard and no flavor to speak of.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: will buy again
customer_reviews.text: it was a great price and the flavor was great
customer_reviews.author: nora

customer_reviews.title: Justines Almond butter is better
customer_reviews.text: I keep getting the chocolate hazelnut almond butter- I keep (2x) getting the wrong flavor!! Wish I could get the regulat almond butter, seems like it is stuck on this other flavor😩
customer_reviews.author: janet shryock

customer_reviews.title: very hard and dry
customer_reviews.text: this should be high quality almond butter however it was hard and dry, impossible to spread. Could not find the expiration date on the bottle
customer_reviews.author: Stanis B

customer_reviews.title: Yes it's good
customer_reviews.text: It was good tasting , but I need no sugar no salt Almond butter!!
customer_reviews.author: Kay L..

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Almond butter and arrives every month.
customer_reviews.text: Love that a bottle comes every month! It's a great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: hawki

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and Nutritious
customer_reviews.text: Almond butter is not only healthful, but it's delicious. I love it on Finn Crisp whole grain crackers, also delicious and nutritious.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Stith

customer_reviews.title: Good taste
customer_reviews.text: Good quality food. I usually buy the almond butter from Costco. This time I try this, it is better taste than the Costco one.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Uses palm oil
customer_reviews.text: This brand surprisingly uses palm oil, which is bad for the environment and not necessary to make a great tasting and spreadable almond butter. Would recommend finding a different brand with one ingredient: Almonds.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Harper

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: The flavor was good but not much different from the almond butter I brought from BJ’s. The almond butter from BJ’s is more worth it value wise.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: All Family Fav
customer_reviews.text: A family fav and a delicious treat for my giant black poodle, Queen B, who has peanut allergy.
customer_reviews.author: T.Y. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Yum!
customer_reviews.text: Low sugar, healthy, easy on the belly. I just eat too much of it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzabelle

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Stale
customer_reviews.text: Tastes stale. Much better quality available at my local grocer.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing with apples
customer_reviews.text: Was curious about any type of almond or peanut butter from Amazon. Gave this a try and ate it very quickly! Smooth taste but it was a little thick to spread. Will order again!
customer_reviews.author: patricia barille

customer_reviews.title: tasty and without all the junk
customer_reviews.text: This is tasty almond butter without any extra crap. It is a little dry compared to other almond butters I have had but overall the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: LIM

customer_reviews.title: Tastes expired but can’t return
customer_reviews.text: This bottle has an undistinguishable expiration date. Once opened it was clearly long over expired. The product tastes like dirt and it cannot be returned. Business practice or honest mistake? From other reviews I’ll let you decide
customer_reviews.author: Kaylyn Robison

customer_reviews.title: STIR no More
customer_reviews.text: Justin's has great flavor and you never get tennis elbow stirring it, and stirring it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great taste !
customer_reviews.text: Best almond butter on the market ! Great taste .
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Mogen

customer_reviews.title: No stir???
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what No Stir means to you but both my jars are filled with 1/2 in of oily goop on top...yuk
customer_reviews.author: T Crane

product_meta.title: Justin's Classic Almond Butter, Only Two Ingredients, No Stir, Gluten-free, Non-GMO, Keto-friendly, Responsibly Sourced, 16 Ounce Jar, Pack of 1
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Pound (Pack of 1)Nut Butter Almond Classic Jar. It is a high quality healthy product. This product is good for health. This product is manufactured in united states.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




Justin's Products Our products are made with common sense and the highest quality. We think that selectively choosing fine, naturally delicious ingredients creates better tasting products. And we are certain your tastebuds will agree. Enjoy our naturally delicious, high-quality nut butters, nut butter snacks and organic peanut butter cups for their great taste, unique texture and convenient nutrition.

Nuts for Sustainability At Justin’s, we strive to make more than delicious products; we hope to make a difference. To name just a few initiatives: Mindfully Sourced Ingredients, Pollinator Conservation, Hunger Relief Support, Organic and Rainforest Alliance Certified Cocoa...and many more! As we grow, so does our ability to give back. Join us. 




One-of-a-Kind Grind It all started with a jar. With the help of a simple food processor and the highest quality ingredients available, Justin revolutionized the world of nut butter to create products driven by a passion for delicious taste, unique texture and quality ingredients. First, he created them for his adventures. Now, he makes them for you.

First Ever Nut Butter Squeeze Pack As the first nut butter brand to market protein-packed nut butters in single-serve squeeze packs, Justin’s provides a convenient source of nutrition for an active lifestyle. Available in 7 varieties, squeeze packs are perfect to enjoy on toast, fruit or right out of the pack. So, give your favorite nut butter a squeeze anytime, anywhere and on anything.

Peanut Butter Cup Perfection What’s more perfect than peanut butter and chocolate? By blending his artisanal peanut butter with high quality chocolate, Justin created a better-for-you alternative to the conventional peanut butter cup. 100% organic, Rainforest Alliance-certified, gluten free and delicious. Yup, it’s how a peanut butter cup should taste. Available in dark, milk, or white chocolate, and miniature-sized if you're adventurous.




#fueledbyjustins The story began in 2004 when Justin Gold, a lover of the active lifestyle, moved to Boulder, Colorado in his 20’s. In order to fuel his long bike rides, Justin embarked on a mission to create new varieties of nut butter that not only packed the protein, but also tasted great. He began crafting the very first batches of his now-famous, culinary nut butters in his home kitchen.




About the Company Describe your product in 3 words.

Nuts. Fuel. Delicious.

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

Given that nut butter was a staple in my vegetarian diet, plain old peanut butter just wasn’t cutting it. I started grinding my own flavors and an assortment of experimental nut butters began to fill the cabinets. After weeks of hungry roommates stealing my tasty creations, I wrote my name on the jar and Justin's was born.

What makes your product special?

When I first started making nut butter, I didn’t overthink whether it was “smooth” or “crunchy”, I just made it because it tasted good, that is made with common sense ingredients and fills a lifestyle need. That’s what I continue to do today, focus on making naturally delicious products. It’s simple really. Simple, and delicious.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

It’s the creative and collaborative aspect of innovating that makes every day exciting. And, as we grow, we continue to invest in our commitment to corporate consciousness. We have the opportunity to truly be visionaries and develop great tasting products that people love.
feature_bullets: Organic Honey, Certified Gluten Free, NON GMO Project Verified, Kosher
6g Protein, 4g Sugar, 3g Fiber, 0g Trans Fats, 100 percentage delicious
MEET THE FAMILY : Try our 6 other delicious flavors: Classic, Chocolate Hazelnut, Cinnamon, Maple, Coconut and Vanilla Almond Butter
The product contains almonds and produced on equipment that also processes other tree nuts, peanuts
